author: Mike Spohr
title: This Is The Best Argument For Free-Range Parenting Yet
text:
View this image › 
20th Century Fox ID: 10539705 2. The movement was largely popularized by Lenore Skenazy of the blog Free-Range Kids . Now she has teamed up with Mike Kraus of Mylk Media to make a video that explains why (they think) free-range parenting is where it’s at. Video available at: https://vimeo.com/203524677 . mylkmedia.com / Via vimeo.com ID: 10539346 3. The video tells us that every day, in everything we do, we face risks. View this image › 
mylkmedia.com / Via vimeo.com ID: 10539965 4. But which risks should we actually worry about? To get an answer we need to weigh the risks, but the problem is that it’s hard to gauge risks in a society that feeds us a steady stream of fear. vimeo.com 
vimeo.com 
  ID: 10540084 5. Thanks to the media it can start to seem like our kids are in danger all of the time, and we must never let them out of our sight. View this image › 
mylkmedia.com / Via vimeo.com ID: 10539989 6. But statistics tell us our kids actually have more of a chance of becoming president than being eaten by shark… View this image › 
mylkmedia.com / Via vimeo.com ID: 10539995 7. More chance of winning an Oscar than becoming a victim of terrorism… View this image › 
mylkmedia.com / Via vimeo.com ID: 10545593 8. And are more likely to be struck by lightning than to be abducted by a stranger. View this image › 
mylkmedia.com / Via vimeo.com ID: 10540003 9. So, Skenazy and Kraus tell us, we should put risk in perspective and give our kids the freedom to do the things we liked doing as kids, like play in the park or ride their bike to the store. View this image › 
mylkmedia.com / Via vimeo.com ID: 10540005 10. Basically, the odds are in your favor as a parent, according to Skenazy and Kraus, so let your kids out of the bubble! View this image › 
ID: 10545684 What do you think about this? Totally agree — people worry too much and kids need freedom to thrive! Nope — the odds of bad things happening to my kids may be small, but they’re my kids and I am going to take every precaution to protect them.
